outlineSection.description: Telecommunication and Electronics Engineering intergrats two technologies including Telecommunication technology and Eelectronics teachnology. Telecommunication technology is the communication system over long distance by transmitting electrical signal via cable, propagating electromangetic wave (wireless) or light signal, base on the fundamental of electricity and electronics. Electronics technology focuses on a design of intergrated circuit with components such as diode, transistor, resistor, capacitor, sensors and other components in order to control eletron flow (electricity). Our department provides quality education for students to be able to design system and devices in both technologies to sovle social problems, to be able to conduct research, and to be able to continue to pursuit graduate studies. With our curriculum, students will be able to do group work effectively with leadership and entrepreneurship. After graduate from our program, students are qualified to work in mobile operation companies, Internet service providing companies, TV / Radio Stations, Airports/seaports, factories, and publics/private institutions.

research.title: Growth optimization of Haematococcus pluvialis for astaxanthin and algal powder supplements
research.description: We expect to isolate various microalgal species that potentially produce astaxanthin and other valuable sources of nutrition. We also expect to identify novel species of bacteria that grow associated with microalgae and explore their influence on microalgal cultivation. The optimal growth condition, mutagenesis, and astaxanthin synthesis that will be discovered in this study will play an important protocol and fundamental knowledge toward the future development for large-scale production. Finally, these results will be published in the local or international journal.
research.author: Dr. Hangsak Huy

research.title: Development of probiotic fermented vegetables in Cambodia and their effect on immunue system in vitro
research.description: We highly expect that via this project, we could isolate and characterize potential LAB from many vegetables fermented food to use as a starter for traditional Cambodian fermented food. Moreover, through this significant project, we hope to establish acceptable formula to transform the production of tradition fermented vegetable from family scale to proper packaging that meet the standard safety for the food level. This research outcome will also serve as literature reference for young researcher to develop their future research and cooperation with private company will be happened for the bring the final products to the local or oversea market in near future. Lastly, 1 article will be published in the peer review journal.
research.author: Ms. Huoy Laingsun

staff.name: Dr. TIENG Siteng
staff.bio: Received a Ph.D. degree in Material Chemistry from University of Paris 13, France in 2011, after a M.Sc. in Supra-Macromolecular Organic Chemistry from Louis Pasteur University, Strasbourg, France in 2005; and B.Sc. in Chemistry from Royal University of Phnom Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia in 2003. He worked as a Postdoctoral Research Fellow at Laboratory of Process and Materials Sciences (LSPM-CNRS), France in 2012. He has 4 years research experience at Laboratory of Process and Materials Sciences (LSPM-CNRS), France, in nanostructured materials Elaboration and Functionalization, Characterizations, Adsorption process, and Materials applications for Air and Water depollution and Catalysis process. The research has led to 14 papers published in peer review journal.

staff.name: Ms. PHOEURK Chanrith
staff.bio: Received her M.Sc. degree in Biochemistry from Mahidol University in Bangkok, Thailand, in 2013; and a B.Sc. in Biochemistry from Royal University of Phnom Penh, Cambodia, in 2007. She graduated with her B.Sc. with thesis research on “Determination the Persistence of Methyl Parathion in Kale and Kuang Futsio” published in Asian Journal of Water, Environment and Pollution. From her MSc. research work, she published one paper in the Phytochemistry journal, titled “Three novel mutations in alpha-galactosidase gene involving in galactomannan degradation in the endosperm of curd coconut.” She started her career as a lecturer and researcher at Bio-Engineering department, RUPP, in 2014. She is currently pursuing her Ph.D. study in Biochemistry at Umeå University, Sweden supported by the Sweden-RUPP Bilateral Program. She joins the Integrated Structural Biology (ISB) research group, and she is working with a serine protease called Cocoonase, an enzyme that digests silk protein. The long-term goal of her project is to integrate the application of enzyme-based technology in silk production. During her Ph.D. study, she recently published one of the four research papers in the peer-review journal, titled “Milligram scale expression, refolding, and purification of Bombyx mori cocoonase using a recombinant E. coli system (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.pep.2021.105919).” She expects to acquire her Ph.D. degree in late 2023.

staff.name: Dr. LONG Solida
staff.bio: “Received a Ph.D degree in Pharmaceutical and Medicinal Chemistry from University of Porto, Porto, Portugal in 2019, after a M.Sc. in Biosystem Engineering from Seoul National University, Seoul, South Korea, in 20012; and B.Sc. in Food Technology from Mae Fah Lung University, Chang Rai, Thailand in 2007, and B.Sc in Biochemistry from Royal University of Phnom Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia in 2002. She is now joining a member of sub-committee of ASIAN-COSTI Food Science and Technology and ASIEAN-COSTI Science and Marine Technology. She is working in two research themes - Natural products and Food Products development. She has 6 years research experience at Laboratory Organic and Pharmaceutical Chemistry, Portugal, in drug synthesis and natural product mimetic drug focus on chiral compounds, enantioselective synthesis, and natural product extraction/elucidation. She also has some years’ experience in developing protein food product using microbial enzyme to improve the food characteristics and another track is the utilization of a recombinant microbial enzyme on carbohydrate to develop drug inclusion material in Thailand and South Korea. The researches have led to 8 papers published in peer review journal.

staff.name: Dr. HUY Hangsak
staff.bio: “Received a Ph.D degree of Bioscience (Functional Genomics) from University of Science and Technology (UST), Daejeon, Republic of Korea in 2019, after a M.Sc. of Green Chemistry and Environmental Biotechnology from UST in 2011; a B.Sc. of Biology from Royal University of Phnom Penh in 2005. /hDuring his graduated study, he had conducted the research at Korea Research Institute of Bioscience and Biotechnology campus on various topics including cellular aging, anti-cancer drug activity, NK cells, bacterial isolation associated to the cyanobacterial bloom, and microalgae research. The novel finding which led him to publish 7 articles in peer review journals as the first author and co-author. /hCurrently, he is working on the project called “Growth Optimization of Haematococcus pluvialis for Astaxanthin and Algal Powder Supplements” that supported by World Bank under HEIP project (2021-2023).

staff.name: Ms. HOUY Laingshun
staff.bio: “Received a M.Sc. degree in Microbiology from Mahidol University in Bangkok, Thailand 2012, after a B.Sc. in Biochemistry from Royal University of Phnom Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia in 2007. In 2009, she obtained a scholarship award from ASEAN UNINET for M.Sc. in Microbiology at Mahidol University, Bangkok, Thailand. She graduated in 2011. Soon later, she was accepted as a Fall 2011 Internship program of UNU & GIST Joint Programme on Science and Technology for Sustainability, International Environmental Research Center (IERC) at Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology (GIST), Gwangju, South Korea. In 2019, she continues doctoral degree in Biomedical Science at Swedish University of Agriculture Science (SLU). /hTill now, Mrs. Laingshun Huoy has accomplished 6 International publications. In 2012, she received an Excellent Poster 3rd award from MUSC GradExpo 2012 on "MOLECULAR AND PHENOTYPIC CHARACTERIZATION OF SALMONELLA ENTERICA SEROTYPES TYPHIMURIUM AND 4,5,12:i:- IN THAILAND" at Faculty of Science, Mahidol University, Bangkok, Thailand.

staff.name: Ms. UNG Sivlin
staff.bio: “Received a M.Sc. degree in Biotechnology from King MongKut’s University of Technology Thonburi in Bangkok, Thailand 2014 under the support scholarship from UNESCO Biotechnology School in Asia.  Back to 2012, she obtained a B.Sc. in Biology from Royal University of Phnom Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She had experience working at Pasture Institute of Cambodia from 2015-2017 in the immunology team. She is now doing doctoral degree in veterinary at Department of Veterinary Science, Graduate School of Life and Environmental Sciences Osaka Prefecture University, Japan. She expects to finish in 2024.

staff.name: Dr. PHAT Phanna
staff.bio: “Received a Ph.D. and M.Sc. degree in Agricultural Biology from Jeonbuk National University, Jeonju, Republic of Korea in 2018 and 2013 respectively, after a B.Sc. in Biology from Royal University of Phnom Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia in 2011. Toward her Ph.D. study, she worked as a researcher at Watermelon Experiment Station, Jeollbuk-do Agricultural Research and Extension Services, Gochang, Republic of Korea for 3 years (2013-2016) and at National Agrobiodiversity Center (NAC), National Institute of Agricultural Sciences, Rural Development Administration, Jeonju for 2 years (2016-2018), which resulted in two research articles published in peer review journal and one Ph.D. thesis on watermelon spontaneous tetraploid variants, polymorphism, and enhancement of germination. She graduated her M.Sc. by a thesis research on Effects of gene silencing suppressors on Potato virus X (PVX) and Potato leafroll virus (PLRV) infection in two Nicotiana species and published a peer review journal on soybean regeneration, after a B.Sc. thesis on Salt tolerance between Arabidopsis thaliana and Tellunggiela parvula. /hShe has 2 years experiences of agrobiodiversity management at NAC, Korea and 1 year experience of Genebank management at Cambodian Agricultural Research and Development (CARDI), Cambodia. She has published an article entitled The Implementation of Digital Object Identifier on Germplasms at the Genebank of CARDI in IAARD Press, Indonesia.

staff.name: Dr. PHAT Phanna
staff.bio: “Received a M.Sc. degree in Material chemistry from Kongju National University in Kongju, Republic of Korea 2016, after a B.Sc. in chemistry from Royal University of Phnom Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia in 2012. /hHe graduated his M.Sc. by a thesis research on “Synthesis of Al-Dope ZinO under sulvothermal condintions”, under a scholarship award from Global Korean scholarship for M.Sc. in material chemistry at Kongju National University, South Korea. Now, he is working as research assistant for HIEP projects. He is responsible for analytical chemistry course for undergraduate program.

staff.name: Ms. Eat Sokhoeun
staff.bio: "Received her M.Sc. degree in Biochemical and Technology from King MongKut’s University of Technology Thonburi in Bangkok, Thailand, in 2020, after a B.Sc. in Bio-engineering from Royal University of Phnom Penh, Cambodia in 2018. She graduated her M.Sc. degree under research topic " Cloning, Expression and Characterization of Lactose 2-epimerase from Halocella sp. Strain SP3-1 to Produce Epilactose from Lactose" and her B.Sc. under research topic “Study the Effects of Dengue, and Zika Virus Infection on B Lymphocyte”. She is now working as a lecturer at Bio-engineering Department, Royal University of Phnom Penh.

staff.name: Ms. Hun  Sreymom
staff.bio: “Received a M.Sc. degree in Food Science and Technology from Mae Fah Luang University in Chiang Rai, Thailand 2021, after a B.Sc. in Bio-Engineering from Royal University of Phnom Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia in 2018. She graduated with her M.Sc. by thesis research on” The effect of pineapple waste on the quality attributes of frozen yogurt” under a scholarship award from the Thailand Scholarship program”. In 2015, she was selected as a student to join the exchange culture program with Fukuoka University, Japan.  In 2017, she was attended in PEACE Kickoff Symposium, at Hiroshima University, Japan. Soon later, she was accepted to join in Global Internship Program at Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology (GIST), Gwangju, South Korea, 2017. /hNowadays, she is working as a lecturer in the department of Bio-Engineer and research assistant for the HELP project.

project.title: Sericin Liquid Soap
project.description: Silk cocoon is natural biopolymer that composed of proteins like fibroin and sericin. Due to sericin provide many benefits such as antioxidant, moisturizer, UV protection, coagulant, chemo-protective and nutrient, we create liquid soap.
